Description: Two joinig fragments of flanged lid of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; underside reserved; exterior: on lid, black-figure decoration consisting of bull to left (back and rump missing; added red on eye, muzzle, neck and underbelly); part of incised rosette as filling ornament; below, two dilute bands; on top of rim, rays; on edge, short vertical bars.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the bulls are usually shown standing or walking in procession to the right. Unusually, the bull on this sherd faces left.

Lemos places this sherd in Stage 1 of Group D of the Sphinx and Lion Style. Although the imagery is lively, the execution of the figures is loose and careless. The rosette on vases of Stage 1 appears infantile.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 141, p. 148, p. 314, no. 1339)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VI, no. 30, pl. XII, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2072) (phase 2)
